page.title: 14FRAMPTON SMALL BUSINESSES
page.content: The{Agricultural Contractors}in Middlegate Road is a family firm with the fourth generation now in charge. 5 people are employed and machinery is used within a 30 mile radius. Harvest time is the busiest season when cereals, rape and beet are harvested. No ploughing is now undertaken. The{Coach Hire Company}in Ralphs Lane is another family firm. 8 coaches are owned from 12 seater minibuses to 53 seater coaches. In term time the coaches take children to and from local schools. Most trips are within the United Kingdom but visits are made to France. 2 full time and 10 part-time drivers are employed. Since 1974 a{manufacturer of cooked {meats}has had a depot in West End Road Frampton. 25-30 people are employed preparing roast ham, pork,tongue, etc.
